title: Queen Consort Camilla Tests Positive for COVID 1 Year After First Diagnosis
author: Rosa Sanchez
description: All her upcoming engagements have been canceled.
cleaned_text: Camilla, Queen Consort, has tested positive for COVID-19, Buckingham Palace confirmed this morning. "After suffering the symptoms of a cold, Her Majesty The Queen Consort has tested positive for the Covid virus," the palace said in a statement. The senior royal has therefore canceled all her public engagements for the week. She "sends her sincere apologies to those who had been due to attend them," per the palace. The news comes one year (minus a day) after the queen consort [tested positive for the virus](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a39073763/duchess-camilla-tests-positive-for-covid/) for the first time. Just four days after King Charles [tested positive for COVID-19](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a39036482/prince-charles-second-covid-19-diagnosis/) in February 2022, a Clarence House spokesperson confirmed to [BAZAAR.com](https://urldefense.com/v3/__http://BAZAAR.com__;!!Ivohdkk!0dx3Tv_nn7MUuv6UgBlvDkDcXmRxisS5YZZ7J-DzYbjFU4c2vyI2K08gq87SPPO6pNVsWA$) that Camilla also had the virus. On Valentine's Day of that year, the spokesperson said, "Her Royal Highness The Duchess of Cornwall has tested positive for COVID-19 and is self-isolating. We continue to follow government guidelines." Camilla has received at least three COVID-19 vaccines, BAZAAR learned. As readers may recall, the late Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for the virus shortly after now King Charles and Camilla last year. Charles visited his mother at Windsor Castle on February 8, 2022, and the queen was [confirmed to be positive](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a39151540/queen-elizabeth-covid-19-diagnosis/) on February 22. The monarch recovered quickly, though sadly [passed away](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a38038396/queen-elizabeth-ii-died-age-96/) from unrelated illness on September 8. Camilla's second coronavirus diagnosis comes after a busy week of royal engagements for her, King Charles, and the [Prince and Princess of Wales](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a42812396/princess-kate-brown-coat-cornwall-prince-william/). On Thursday, February 9, the queen consort visited the STORM Family Centre in London's Battersea as it marked its 19th anniversary, [per the palace](https://www.royal.uk/royal-week-4-10-february-2023).
